trans-unit.source: Represents a condition that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.

<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions and a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
The SamlDoNotCacheCondition class represents one of the conditions defined by the SAML specification and it asserts that the SAML assertion must not be cached.
To specify this condition for a SAML assertion, add the SamlDoNotCacheCondition class to the collection returned by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Conditions%2A> property.

> [!NOTE] > When the SamlDoNotCacheCondition is added as a condition to a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token that is issued by a security token service for the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] client, a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] client does cache the security token.
Because the client does not inspect the contents of the issued token, the token is cached.
The client is token agnostic for issued tokens type and processes it the returned issued token as an opaque XML element.

However, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] security never caches the received issued token on the service side; it only caches the claims that are extracted from it during the token authentication process.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" name="<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" href=""></xref> element from the specified XML reader.
The ReadXml method does note set any properties.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" name="<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" href=""></xref>.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML authorization statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is -or- samlSerializer is
reader does not point to a element.
Writes the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" name="<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" href=""></xref> element into the specified XML serializer.
Use the WriteXml method to write the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition> instance into a `<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>` element.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" name="<saml:DoNotCacheCondition>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
writer is -or- samlSerializer is
